My Role:

Understand the steps that tasks currently take in normal scenerios that people experience in Edge today.

B. Introduce new in-context and out-of-context accelerators to the browsers' ux framework and interaction models.

Context Menu

Context Menu's allows users to interact with multiple surfaces across the browser but faces certain limitations from sending to other devices, smart / quick info, currency conversion, definitions,and other interactions.

A. Understand the steps that tasks currently take in normal scenerios that people experience in Edge today.

B. Introduce new in-context and out-of-context accelerators to the browsers' ux framework and interaction models.

Accelerators In Edge

This is a simple breakdown of the accelerator surfaces that contain a specfic need and function depending on the context of the browser. You can see the different sections of the frames and how we categorize them.

  1. Tab Band: Add, organize & pin tabs
  2. Address Bar: Navigation, extensions, shortcuts & more menu
  3. Favorite Bar: Add, organize & quickly access favorites
  4. Omnibox: In-line search suggestions & search history
  5. Side Pane: In-context/multi-tasking for collections & quick search
  6. Context Menu: In-context/multi-tasking

Pain Point

The more actions & features added, the context menu becomes bloated & overwhelming

The only way to invoke the context menu is by right-clicking or by touch & hold

Some actions are not used by customers, so why should they always see these actions?

Opportunity

  1. Build an adaptive & dynamic framework that expands across context menu experiences
  2. Explore other natural ways to invoke the menu for quicker access
  3. Personalize & show smart actions that build on your behavior

Dynamic

Build an accelerator framework into the context menu that will allow for more dynamic content to be displayed in-line.

This will help to bring information closer to the user, and quickly interact with content.

Responsive

Besides reconfiguring the IA, to further help with large, overwhelming context menus, we can experiment with a lightweight mini context menu.

Clicking on "..More actions" will open access to the full context menu.
